qas.question: All Freemasons are progressively initiated, passed, and raised in three degrees of what?
The initiations are part allegory and part what?
What is the final of the three steps of Freemasonry?
Who was the chief architect of the Temple of Solomon?
How many versions of the Hiram myth are there?
What are all Freemasons progressively initiated, passed, and raised in six degrees of?
What is the final of the seven steps of Freemasonry?
Who was the worst architect of the Temple of Solomon?
How many versions of the Hiram flag are there?
What is the first step for only some Freemasons?

context: All Freemasons begin their journey in the "craft" by <b9_0>being progressively initiated<b9_0/>, passed and raised into the three degrees of <a0_0><b5_0>Craft, or Blue Lodge Masonry<b5_0/><a0_0/>. During these three rituals, the candidate is progressively taught the meanings of the Lodge symbols, and entrusted with grips, signs and words to signify to other Masons that he has been so initiated. The initiations are part allegory and part <a1_0>lecture<a1_0/>, and revolve around the construction of the Temple of Solomon, and the artistry and death of his chief architect, <a3_0><b7_0>Hiram Abiff<b7_0/><a3_0/>. The degrees are those of Entered apprentice, Fellowcraft and <a2_0><b6_0>Master Mason<b6_0/><a2_0/>. While many different versions of these rituals exist, with <a4_0><b8_0>at least two<b8_0/><a4_0/> different lodge layouts and versions of the Hiram myth, each version is recognisable to any Freemason from any jurisdiction.
